string.text: A simple leather jacket and an old shotgun is the bare minimum required to protect oneself from the surrounding reality. By examining the contents in the jacket, one may find a rag mask, a torch, and a pack of cigarettes. Bare-bones, but better than nothing.

Reliable and well-proven weaponry in the conditions of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone: a good old-fashioned AK-74U with magazines, several grenades, and a high-quality knife, all constituting a versatile set of weaponry against any living, breathing threat.

A small supply of food and medicine, designed for surviving in and adapting to the first few days in a life- and health-threatening environment. Includes several cans of food, a first-aid kit, bandages, anti-radiation pills, a pack of activated carbon, and home-brewed beverage.

The most important equipment for exploring anomalous areas: a gas mask, a dosimeter, an artefact detector, a lead container, and, of course, a capacious backpack. The rest depends on the skill, fortune, and ingenuity of the wearer themselves.

A kit for those who regret time spent if they haven't repaired or dismantled something. A basic set of tools, a hammer, a tube of quality glue, a little oil, and blue electrical tape. Luckily enough, there is an old optical sight as well. Looks like the trader mistakenly included it...

A strong outfit with excellently balanced properties. The death of the two previous owners of the suit has, fortunately, not affected its appearance or condition, and for the lack of disgust and any prejudice, the local trader has offered a capable torch.

A favourable suit of armour with different kinds of pockets and pouches for storing a variety of small objects. Sowing batteries, silenced pistol, radio components, a torn page from a magazine, an old lighter; it is unclear how keeping all this rubbish to yourself would be of any use. On the other hand, no one knows in advance if something could come in handy.
The arme blanche has always attracted you; its even metallic gloss has a calming effect on you. Of course, firearms are convenient, but with a knife in your hand, you feel complete.

As a child, you assembled a radio from old parts in your father’s box. In your youth, you repaired your motorcycle with spare parts from a flea market. Now, you feel that you will find use to the technical debris of the Exclusion Zone with certainty.

Tasty, high-quality food in the Zone is a rarity, and what stalkers usually eat is hard to consider useful; but you are able to consume and digest what any other person in their right mind won’t even consider having a bite of.

The gifts of the Zone are alluring but extremely dangerous. Not so long ago, you acquired a special backpack, which should be able to neutralise some of their radiation. The time has come to put it to use.

In whatever condition and situation you find yourself in, whether it be in emotional shock, a wild hangover, or a small earthquake while travelling on public transport; your hand never falters. The grip on your weapon is tight enough to leave dents on the hand guard and stock.

Your presence instils fear into the creatures of the Zone; to little surprise, because you are the last thing they see in their life in the vast majority of cases. Having learned how to deal with the mutant carcass after an encounter, people begin to fear you.

Whether through charm, a natural ability to socialise, or perhaps a subtle knowledge of human psychology; it does not matter. You easily win the hearts of any person, whether it be a greedy huckster or an outspoken psychopath.

You have learned to notice the most insignificant details not only in the behaviour of people, but also in the surrounding environment. During searches, not a single kopeck, bolt, or person manages hides from you…
Humming, hissing, spitting; no types of anomalies are capable of intimidating you any longer, and your urge for exploration encourages a deep study of anomalous areas.
